tier_reasoning: Ten tiers provides granular control across the full spectrum from G-rated to extreme explicit content. This allows users to fine-tune exactly where they want the boundary, particularly in the critical middle ranges (PG-13 to R to NC-17) where small differences matter significantly. Fewer tiers would be too coarse; more would create decision paralysis.

tiers.description: Completely chaste. Romance is emotional only - hand holding, meaningful glances, maybe a forehead kiss.
tiers.what_you_will_see: Longing looks, emotional connection, hand holding, characters blushing, declarations of love
tiers.what_you_wont_see: Kissing on the lips, any physical intimacy beyond hand holding, bedroom scenes, suggestive dialogue
messages: Pure as freshly fallen snow. Think Hallmark Christmas movies where the most scandalous thing is holding hands while ice skating.
G-rated romance. Characters will fall deeply in love but express it through meaningful glances and maybe a hand squeeze.
Disney princess tier. True love's kiss might happen but it's fade-to-black before lips even touch.
Your grandmother could read this aloud at church. Maximum spice level: holding hands for three full seconds.
Chaste as a Victorian letter. Romance is expressed through yearning looks and accidentally touching hands while reaching for the same book.
media_references: Pride and Prejudice (2005) but only the hand flex scene

tiers.description: Innocent romance with closed-mouth kissing allowed. Focus on emotional intimacy and romantic gestures.
tiers.what_you_will_see: Gentle kisses, hugging, cuddling, romantic dates, sweet declarations of love, innocent physical affection
tiers.what_you_wont_see: Passionate kissing, bedroom scenes, partial nudity, suggestive touching, sexual tension
messages: PG romance territory. Kisses happen but they're sweet pecks, not makeout sessions. Think 'The Princess Bride' smooch.
Wholesome but romantic. Characters can kiss goodbye and hold each other, but bedroom doors stay firmly closed (and locked, and we don't mention them).
Like your favorite YA romance novel. Sweet kisses, lots of blushing, maybe falling asleep on someone's shoulder. That's as spicy as it gets.
Netflix with your parents tier. A few tender kisses, some cuddling on the couch. Nobody's clothes are coming off.
Clean romance. Physical affection is innocent and sweet - a kiss in the rain, a warm embrace. The most scandalous thing is butterflies in the stomach.
media_references: To All the Boys I've Loved Before

tiers.description: Romance heats up with passionate kissing and mild sensuality. Sexual tension acknowledged but not explored.
tiers.what_you_will_see: Passionate kissing, making out, characters noticing physical attraction, mild innuendo, tension-filled moments, clothes stay on
tiers.what_you_wont_see: Nudity, bedroom scenes (even implied), graphic description of bodies, sexual acts, heavy petting
messages: PG-13 spice. Makeout sessions happen, characters definitely want each other, but we cut away before anything happens. Think Marvel movie romance.
Like Twilight but without the vampire restraint metaphor. Passionate kisses, definite sexual tension, but bedroom door remains theoretical.
Young adult territory. Characters are clearly attracted and might have a heated makeout session against a wall, but that's where we draw the curtain.
Movie theater date safe. Some steamy kisses and longing glances that mean more, but nothing that makes you want to leave the room when watching with family.
Teen drama level. Characters might fall into bed kissing but then we're immediately cutting to the next morning at breakfast. What happened? That's classified.

tiers.description: Sexual activity clearly happens but is not described. Classic 'cut to morning after' approach.
tiers.what_you_will_see: Clear indication intimacy occurred, passionate moments leading up to it, clothes coming off (fade to black immediately), waking up together implications
tiers.what_you_wont_see: Any description of sexual acts, explicit body descriptions during intimate moments, what actually happened in bed
messages: Hollywood R-rated romance. Characters clearly sleep together but the camera pans to the fireplace/curtains/window at the crucial moment.
Fade to black tier. Shirts start coming off, characters move to the bedroom, and... scene. Next thing we see is morning coffee.
Like a tasteful romance novel. You know they had sex because they wake up in bed together and reference 'last night,' but we skipped that chapter.
Broadcast TV drama level. Sexual activity is strongly implied through passionate kissing, clothes dropping, and then BOOM - next morning. Use your imagination.
The author believes in your imagination. Characters are about to get intimate, the scene fades out, and we rejoin them looking very satisfied at breakfast.
media_references: Titanic (the car scene but fade out)

tiers.description: Intimacy shown with euphemistic language and suggestive description. No graphic details but clearly more than 'fade to black.'
tiers.what_you_will_see: Euphemistic descriptions of intimacy, physical sensations described tastefully, clear romantic/sexual activity using poetic language, aftermath details
tiers.what_you_wont_see: Clinical anatomical terms, explicit play-by-play, graphic body part descriptions, pornographic detail
messages: R-rated romance. Bedroom scenes happen and are described, but in poetic, euphemistic terms. 'Their bodies intertwined' not... anatomical specifics.
Fifty Shades if you squint and it was written by Jane Austen. Things definitely happen, they're described tastefully, but no one's saying anatomical words.
Literary fiction spice level. Sexual scenes exist and are described through sensation and emotion rather than mechanics. Think 'waves of pleasure' not instruction manual.
HBO shows at 9pm. Intimate scenes are present and somewhat detailed but still using metaphor and artful language. More suggestion than specification.
Romance novel territory. You'll read about intimate encounters but they're described with euphemisms and focus on emotion/sensation rather than graphic detail.

Game of Thrones level (the romantic scenes, not the problematic ones). Sex happens on screen with some detail but it's still part of character development.
Spicy romance novel. The bedroom scenes are explicit and use clearer language, but they're still romantic encounters between characters we care about.
This is where 'adult romance' lives. Intimate scenes are described with enough detail that you know exactly what's happening, but it's still storytelling, not porn.
HBO at 10pm. Sexual content is explicit and detailed but contextualized within relationships and narrative. More graphic than fade-to-black, less graphic than XXX.

implementation_notes.safety_guardrails: Even at tier 10 (90-100%), illegal content (underage, non-consensual, etc.) should be hard-blocked by content filters. 'Extreme' means extreme legal content only.
implementation_notes.tier_selection_ux: Consider showing tier name, rating equivalent, and one rotating message when user hovers over slider. Full description on click.

combination_with_other_sliders.romance_low_adult_high: Physical encounters without emotional connection - hookups, casual sex, purely physical
combination_with_other_sliders.romance_high_adult_low: Deep emotional romance with minimal physical content - focus on feelings and connection
combination_with_other_sliders.sensuality_moderate_adult_extreme: Explicit sexual content with tension and attraction but not necessarily romance

implementation_notes.content_warnings: Recommend showing clear content warnings before generation at tiers 7+ (60%+), and requiring explicit confirmation at tiers 9+ (80%+)
implementation_notes.age_verification: Tiers 6+ (50%+) should require age verification. Tiers 8+ (70%+) should require explicit 'I understand this is adult content' confirmation.
implementation_notes.default_value: Recommend default of tier 3 (20-29%) - allows romance and tension without explicit content. Safe for most users.
implementation_notes.message_rotation: Rotate through message variations on each page load to keep UI fresh and amusing while still being informative.
